value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 18: Adding Interactive Features - Part 1

The Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day online course aims to empower you as a report author with the technical knowledge required to create, publish, and distribute Power BI paginated reports. value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: Aggregation to speed up the performance of a Power BI report even if all IMPORTED
value.excerpt: One of the questions I normally get after presenting about aggregations in Power BI is that, does the aggregation works only for Composite mode and in scenarios to speed up the DirectQuery? or does it work in import mode as well? This video is about this question and shows how you can speed up your model

value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.excerpt: If you want to create a row-number statically as a pre-calculation in Power BI, then Power Query has a very simple way of doing it; Add Index Column. value.title: Dynamically change the format of values in Power BI
value.excerpt: Can you change the format of a measure or a value in Power BI dynamically? Is it possible to set a value to be a percentage sometimes, and sometimes to be a currency? can you change the currency format? The answer to all these questions is yes. value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to connect to a Power BI dataset from Excel using Analyze in Excel? if yes, you might have had this experience that your values don’t show in Excel’s Pivot table as values. This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article
